intro: Turbinicarpus beguinii subsp. haenkeanus, commonly known as the Haenkean turbinicarpus, is a species of flowering plant in the Cactaceae family. It is native to the arid regions of Mexico, specifically the state of San Luis Potosí. This cactus is characterized by its ribbed, cylindrical stems that are typically green and covered with white to yellow spines. The flowers are usually yellow or orange, emerging from the areoles, and bloom in the spring. It is a slow-growing, compact cactus that requires well-draining soil and full sun to thrive.
